abstract.para: This topic outlines the complete workflow to deploy the &productnameshort; product. It aims to clarify the deployment process to get good understanding of its complexity, find minimum hardware requirements, and steps to take after the deployment.

itemizedlist.para: Before deploying &productnameshort;, the following must be fulfilled:

listitem.para: You have installed &ranchermanager; as documented in .
You have deployed and configured &ssecurity; as documented in .
You have deployed and configured &sobservability; as documented in .
For basic functionality, &productnameshort; has the same hardware requirements as the &rke2; distribution with at least 32 GB of RAM. Refer to for details.

To use the &nvidia; GPU Operator, you need a compatible GPU hardware. Refer to
for details.

step.para: Install and register &slm; 6.0 or later on each &rke2; cluster node. Refer to for details.

If you plan to utilize the computing power of &nvidia; GPUs, install the &nvidia; GPU driver on cluster nodes with GPUs. Refer to
for details.

Install the &nvidia;container toolkit on GPU enabled systems. Refer to
for details.
Install &rke2; &kube; distribution on the cluster nodes. Refer to for details.
Configure the GPU enabled nodes so that the &productnameshort; containers are assigned to Pods that run on nodes equipped with &nvidia; GPU hardware. Find more details assigning Pods to nodes in .
If you previously installed the &nvidia; GPU driver on hosts with GPU hardware, install &nvoperator; with the additional option --set driver.enabled=false. Refer to .
Configure &ssecurity; to scan the nodes that will be used for &productnameshort;. Although this step is not required, we strongly encourage it to ensure the security in production environment.
Configure &sobservability; to observe the nodes with the &productnameshort; application.
